name: Days Inn London Waterloo

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked our stay at the same time as booking Theatre tickets so our weekend only cost us £200, so it was abit of a bargain!
reviews.title: Light sleeper?! .....Take earplugs!
Good old Days Inn
reviews.text: The hotel was nice and clean and the staff were friendly. Its in a great location, a minutes walk from the nearest tube and the Imperial War Museum.... and parking was only £10 a night (compared with £1 an hour at some others....)
Breakfast was extremely busy, so unless you go earlier or later be prepared to stand around a bit, either waiting for a table or for food to be cooked. (no mushrooms though :( )
reviews.title: Don't be misled by the 'Waterloo' tag
Good Value Accommodation
reviews.text: The rooms were clean and tidy, not much wardrobe space though and the only thing was the hotel is right opposite a busy police station, the windows do not contain any noise so if you are a light sleeper take earplugs, like i did, and it was fine!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all we had a lovely weekend and would stop here again, but i wouldn't pay walk in prices.
reviews.title: okay

reviews.text: We spent an overnight stay at this hotel. It was very much as we expected with the 'standard' decor and facilities. Everything was very clean etc but we were put in the TINIEST room I have ever stayed in, A small triangular room in the 'bend' of the corridor. I suppose this was as the hotel was completely full and we were only staying for the one night.
reviews.title: Not great!

likes.liked: — Met the 'standard' for this type of hotel.
likes.disliked: — Lack of organisation form staff anf TINY room.

reviews.title: Very Good Hotel
reviews.text: We were not around long enough to comment on the staff except to say they were 'efficient' - all except for one point with which we were not at all impressed.

reviews.title: Good value, ok rooms, basic business class hotel
reviews.text: We pre-arranged car parking but on arrival they had failed to reserve us a parking place in their limited car park, leaving us to park some distance away! This caused us great inconvenience and some worry about the safety of our vehicle and did a lot to mar the enjoyment of our stay.

Rooms spotless,although quite narrow but sufficient for a 2 night stay. Staff very friendly & helpful. We stayed the weekend of the London Marathon, and on the Sunday we were leaving, there was no room to leave our cases in the designated area. The staff went out of their way to assist us and let us put our luggage in their office space ,although it was an ordinary working day for them.
reviews.title: Tolerable, but only just

reviews.text: Although building does not look very nice from the outside...
reviews.title: very good hotel for reasonable price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good accomodation near Waterloo station for reasonable price with very good service too.
reviews.title: Good budget hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Clean and comfortable rooms (with small windows).
reviews.title: Good Place to Stay

reviews.text: Nearest tube is Lambeth just down the road, but just few minutes more and you are at Waterloo and London Eye...
reviews.title: An Average Hotel
Noisy neighborhood
reviews.text: Imperial War Museum is just accross the road.

description: 162 room hotel ideally situated for London's West End Theatres, cinemas, art galleries, museums & shopping.
